prompt: For each question, assign marks as given in the question paper, either given in brackets or against each question. Generate a numbered Scheme of Evaluation in the following format for ALL the questions in {{file_names}}.:/n/nFor each question, output exactly these three sections:/nQuestion text — copy verbatim from {{file_names}}. If truncated or illegible, append “(incomplete in source)” at the end./n/nAnswer template — bullet the minimum core ideas (or clear equivalents) in strict logical order needed for full credit. Use short, precise bullets. If a single correct answer is unambiguous (value/option/etc.), state it explicitly./n/nMarking scheme (Total = max_marks) — one bullet per core idea, labeled A, B, C in the same order as the Answer template. After each label, put the marks in square brackets, e.g. A [2], then a terse description of the expectation in context. Strictly limit the number of bullets to three./n/nThe marks on A+B+C must sum exactly to max_marks printed in the paper. Ensure there are no errors in this. Recheck the marking scheme if required./n/nInteger-only per-bullet marks: The number inside each square bracket [ ] must be an integer (digits only)—no decimals/fractions (e.g., no [0.5], [1.0], ½). If finer granularity seems needed, restructure by confining to the most essential bullets in the answer./n/nMini-example (for a 5-mark item)/nMarking scheme (Total = 5)/nA [2]: states/defines core principle in this context/nB [2]: applies principle correctly to the given setup/nC [1]: computes/states final result with correct units/justification/n/nIMPORTANT: your only output must be a single JSON object (for single questions) or a JSON array of such objects (for batch), each with these keys:/nQuestion number/nQuestion text/nAnswer template/nMarking scheme/n/nNow generate a JSON array of mark-scheme objects for all questions in {{file_names}}. Each object must have all the keys listed above./n/nQuestion paper: {{file_names}}/nMake sure you use only this file {{file_names}} and give the response for all the questions in the question paper. Maintain the same question order as in {{file_names}}. If a question has sub-parts with separate marks, generate one object per sub-part and suffix 'Question number' accordingly (e.g., '2(a)')./n/nRequired_input_variables/nQuestion paper: {{file_names}}
